nta.declaration: /** * "Cat and Mouse" by Kim Guldstrand Larsen and Marius Mikuƒçionis. * The model is about a cat chasing a mouse in a maze with a narrow passage. * Demonstrates the features of Stratego: * symbolic and SMC queries, TIGA synthesis and optimization using learning. * The system consists of four processes: * - Cat tracks the position and possible moves for the cat. * - Mouse tracks the position and possible moves for the mouse, * has an extra narrow passage to Cheese, that is not available to Cat. * - CatP models the cat player moves (up, left, down, right) with delay. * - MouseP models the mouse player moves (up, left, down, right) with delay. * The objective of the game is for Mouse to get to Cheese location and * avoid being cought by Cat (detected when positions are equal). * Mouse is the player/controller with controllable movements. * Cat is the opponent/environment with uncontrollable movements. * The strategy synthesis and optimization queries achieve the specified * objectives by restricting controlable actions. */ const int CP = 2; // delay step size for Cat const int MP = 1; // delay step size for Mouse broadcast chan cu, cl, cd, cr; // cat: up, left, down, right broadcast chan mu, ml, md, mr; // mouse: up, left, down, right

transition.label: md?
s=9
Narrow passage only mice can use.

nta.system:
clock time; // used in minimization queries
system Cat, Mouse, CatP, MouseP;

query.comment: // GOAL: can Mouse reach Cheese?

query.formula: E<> Mouse.Cheese // Can Mouse reach Cheese?
query.comment: Expect YES, satisfied, Mouse can reach Cheese. The query also loads a witness trace into Symbolic Simulator.

query.formula: simulate [<=100; 20] { Mouse.s } // Where is Mouse most of the time?
query.comment: Expect trajectory all over entire maze, locations 0 through 12. Inspect the simulations by right-clicking the query.

query.formula: simulate [<=100; 100] { Mouse.s } : 1 : Mouse.Cheese // Show trajectory of Mouse raching Cheese
query.comment: Expect a trajectory through random locations eventually reaching value 3 (Cheese location).

query.formula: Pr[<=1000](<> Mouse.Cheese) // Probability of Mouse reaching Cheese?
query.comment: Expect close to 100%, i.e. given enough time Mouse will eventually reach Cheese. Cumulative Probability Distribution (right-click on the query) shows that it takes about 147 time units on average. The query also provides a trace for Concrete Simulator to step through.
// OPTIMIZE: strategy for Mouse to reach Cheese as Fast as possible

query.formula: strategy Fast = minE(time) [<=100] { Mouse.location } -> {} : <> Mouse.Cheese // Minimize expected time for Mouse reaching Cheese
query.comment: Expect success. The resulting strategy can be used in SMC and learning queries.

query.formula: simulate [<=100; 20] { Mouse.s } under Fast // Where is Mouse while using Fast strategy?
query.comment: Expect homing to and motion between locations 2, 3, 5, 6 around Cheese at 3.

query.formula: Pr[<=100](<> Mouse.Cheese) under Fast >= Pr[<=100](<> Mouse.Cheese) // Compare probabilities of Mouse reaching Cheese with and without Fast
query.comment: Expect YES, satisfied. The comparison plot shows 0.5 before the first 5 time units (could not distinguish as Mouse is never at Cheese in both cases) and then 1 (probability with Fast is strictly greater than without).

query.formula: Pr[<=100](<> Mouse.Cheese) under Fast // Probability of Mouse reaching Cheese under Fast
query.comment: Expect 100%. Cumulative Probability Distribution shows that Mouse reaches Cheese always in exactly 5 time units.
// Evaluate SAFETY

query.formula: E<> Cat.Cheese // Can Cat get to Cheese?
query.comment: Expect YES, satisfied, Cat can get to Cheese too. A witness trace is loaded into Symbolic Simulator.

query.formula: E<> Cat.s == Mouse.s // Can Cat catch Mouse?
query.comment: Expect YES, satisfied. A witness trace is loaded into Symbolic Simulator.

query.formula: simulate [<=100; 20] { Cat.s } // Where is Cat most of the time?
query.comment: Expect the location to vary all over the maze, values 0 through 12.

query.formula: simulate [<=100] { 13*(Cat.s==Mouse.s), Cat.s, Mouse.s } // Cat and Mouse trajectories with their collisions
query.comment: Expect trajectories of Cat and Mouse and sometimes collision marked in red reaching value 13.

query.formula: simulate [<=100; 100] { 13*(Cat.s==Mouse.s), Cat.s, Mouse.s } : 1 : Cat.s==Mouse.s // Find 1 trajectory where Mouse is cought
query.comment: Expect one trajectory where Cat and Mouse locations collide definately

query.formula: Pr[<=1000](<> Cat.s == Mouse.s) // Probability of Cat catching Mouse?
query.comment: Expect probability close to 100% Cumulative Probability Distribution (right-click on the query) shows Mouse is cought in 44.3 time units on average. A concrete trace leading to collision is loaded into Concrete Simulator.
// Evaluate SAFETY of Fast strategy

query.formula: simulate [<=100; 20] { Cat.s } under Fast // Where is Cat when Mouse uses Fast strategy?
query.comment: Expect trajectories all over the maze, similarly to when Mouse is not using Fast strategy.

query.formula: simulate [<=100] { 13*(Cat.s==Mouse.s), Cat.s, Mouse.s } under Fast // Show trajectories of Cat and Mouse and their collisions
query.comment: Expect to see trajectories of Cat and Mouse locations and sometimes red getting to 13 when they collide.

query.formula: simulate [<=100; 100] { 13*(Cat.s==Mouse.s), Cat.s, Mouse.s } : 1 : Cat.s==Mouse.s under Fast // Find how Mouse is cought under Fast
query.comment: Expect Mouse to home-in to and stay around Cheese, while Cat moves randomly and eventually arrives to location equal to Mouse's.

query.formula: Pr[<=1000](<> Cat.s == Mouse.s) under Fast >= Pr[<=1000](<> Cat.s == Mouse.s) // Is Fast strategy safer than no strategy?
query.comment: Expect success. The comparison plot shows 1 in the beginning -- Fast strategy is safer than no strategy in the very beginning, but later 0 -- less safe later, and eventually 0.5 -- the probabilities could not be distinguished.

query.formula: Pr[<=1000](<> Cat.s == Mouse.s) under Fast // Probability of Cat catching Mouse using Fast strategy?
query.comment: Expect close to 100%. Cumulative Proability Distribution plot shows that it takes 135.8 time units on average (takes longer than when Mouse is not rushing to Cheese)
// SAFETY strategy for Mouse to avoid Cat

query.formula: strategy Safe = control: A[] Cat.s != Mouse.s // Can Mouse avoid Cat?
query.comment: Expect success. The resulting strategy can be used in symbolic (E<>, A[] etc), SMC and learning queries.

query.formula: simulate [<=100; 20] { Cat.s } under Safe // Where is Cat most of the time under Safe?
query.comment: Expect trajectory all over the maze

query.formula: simulate [<=100; 20] { Mouse.s } under Safe // Where is Mouse most of the time under Safe?
query.comment: Expect trajectory all over the maze

query.formula: simulate [<=100; 104] { 14*(Cat.s==Mouse.s), Cat.s, Mouse.s } : 1 : Cat.s==Mouse.s under Safe // Find trajectory of Cat catching Mouse using Safe strategy
query.comment: Expect failure: such trajectory cannot be found. Also the probability is estimated below 5% with 99% confidence level.

query.formula: Pr[<=100](<> Cat.s == Mouse.s) under Safe // Probability of Cat catching Mouse using Safe?
query.comment: Expect probability to be below 0.5% with 99% confidence.

query.formula: A[] Cat.s != Mouse.s under Safe // Can Mouse avoid Cat by using Safe strategy?
query.comment: Expect YES, satisfied, i.e. there is absolutely no way for Cat to catch Mouse using Safe strategy.
// Evaluate PERFORMANCE of the Safe strategy

query.formula: Pr[<=1000](<> Mouse.Cheese) under Safe >= Pr[<=1000](<> Mouse.Cheese) // Is Mouse better at reaching Cheese with or without Safe strategy?
query.comment: Expect YES, the probability of Mouse reaching Cheese is greater with Safe strategy. The Comparison plot shows 1 up to time 650 -- Safe strategy is better than no strategy, but later it shows 0.5 -- it could not distinguish the probabilities from that point.

query.formula: Pr[<=1000](<> Mouse.Cheese) under Fast >= Pr[<=1000](<> Mouse.Cheese) under Safe // Is Mouse better at reaching Cheese with Fast or Safe strategy?
query.comment: Expect YES, the probability of Mouse reaching Cheese greater with Fast than Safe strategy. The Comparison plot shows 1 up to time 470 -- Fast strategy is better than Safe strategy, and later it shows 0.5 -- it could not distinguish the probabilities from that point.

query.formula: Pr[<=1000](<> Mouse.Cheese) under Safe // Probability of Mouse reaching Cheese using Safe
query.comment: Expect probability close to 100%. Cumulative Probability Distribution shows that Mouse reaches Cheese within 124 time units on average -- better than without strategy, but nowhere near the result of using Fast strategy (5 time units).
// SAFE & OPTIMAL: get to Cheese quick without getting cought

query.formula: strategy SafeFast = minE(time) [<=100] { Cat.location, Mouse.location } -> {} : <> Mouse.Cheese under Safe // Optimize Safe strategy for Mouse to reach Cheese in minimal time.
query.comment: Expect success. The resulting strategy can be used only in SMC queries.

query.formula: simulate [<=100; 20] { Cat.s } under SafeFast // Where is Cat under SafeFast?
query.comment: Expect the location trajectory to be all over the maze from 0 through 12.

query.formula: simulate [<=100; 20] { Mouse.s } under SafeFast // Where is Mouse under SafeFast?
query.comment: Expect the location trajectory to home-in to 2,3,5,6 (just like Fast), but occasionally get distracted to other places of the maze.

query.formula: simulate [<=100] { Cat.s, Mouse.s } under SafeFast // Cat and Mouse trajectories under SafeFast
simulate [<=100; 104] { 13*(Cat.s==Mouse.s), Cat.s, Mouse.s } : 1 : Cat.s==Mouse.s under SafeFast // Find trajectory of Cat catching Mouse using SafeFast
query.comment: Expect failure as such trace does ont exist, and the estimated probability is less than 5% with 99% confidence level.

query.formula: Pr[<=1000](<> Cat.s == Mouse.s) under SafeFast // Probability of Cat catching Mouse using SafeFast
query.comment: Expect probability less than 1% with 99% confidence level -- virtually impossible.

query.formula: Pr[<=100](<> Mouse.Cheese) under SafeFast >= Pr[<=100](<> Mouse.Cheese) under Fast // Which SafeFast or Fast is better for reaching Cheese?
query.comment: Expect YES, satisfied. The comparison plot shows 0.5 everywhere, meaning that it could not distinguish the probabilities, i.e. probabilities are approximately equal for entire time duration.

query.formula: Pr[<=100](<> Mouse.Cheese) under SafeFast // Probability of Mouse reaching Cheese using SafeFast
query.comment: Expect probability close to 100%. Cumulative Probability Distribution shows that it always takes 5 time units -- as good result as using Fast strategy.
